bibl.title: EÈerges€aw xãrin. Studies Presented to Benedetto Bravo and Ewa Wipszycka by their Disciples
bibl.note: Add some details to the picture of Soterichos Oasites given in: G. SCHEPENS (Ed.), Die Fragmente der griechischen Historiker Continued. Part Four. Biography and Antiquarian Literature. Vol. IVA. Biography. Fascicle 7. Imperial and Undated Authors. By J. RADICKE (Leiden, 1999) pp. 254-257, No. 1080 (= 641). - I. Soterichos' Ethnikon. - II. General Account of the Work of Soterichos. - III. Pythonor Aleksandriakos. - IV. Two Strasburg Papyri [P. Stras. Inv. 480-481 (= Pack2 1848-1849)]. Soterichos is the most probable author of the poem preserved on P. Stras. Inv. 480; P. Stras. Inv. 481 would contain an introductory part of the Patria Oaseos. - V. P. Oxy. LXIII, 4352. - VI. Conclusions.
DERDA Tomasz and Pawel JANISZEWSKI, Soterichos Oasites Revisited.

Tomasz DERDA, Jakub URBANIK and Marek WECOWSKI (Edd.), EÈerges€aw xãrin. Studies Presented to Benedetto Bravo and Ewa Wipszycka by their Disciples = The Journal of Juristic Papyrology. Supplements. Volume I (Warsaw, 2002) pp. 51-70. <euergesias charin>
364 Carmina varia Graeca Epica Soterichus Oasita
